fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.cloudhopper

Class EncoderBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.fluent.AbstractParent<CloudhopperBuilder>
      • fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.cloudhopper.EncoderBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<Encoder>, Parent<CloudhopperBuilder>

    public class EncoderBuilder
extends AbstractParent<CloudhopperBuilder>
implements Builder<Encoder>
    Configures text message encoding: It supports GSM 03.38 standard encodings. It automatically guess the best supported encoding in order to use the minimum octets:
    • It encodes using GSM 7-bit default alphabet if the message contains only characters defined in the table. Message is packed so the message can have a maximum length of 160 characters. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(Boolean)) and GSM 7-bit is enabled (using gsm7bitPacked(Integer)).
    • It encodes using GSM 8-bit data encoding if the message contains only characters that can be encoded on one octet. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(Boolean)) and GSM 8-bit is enabled (using gsm8bit(Integer)).
    • It encodes using Latin 1 (ISO-8859-1) data encoding if the message contains only characters that can be encoded on one octet. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(Boolean)) and Latin-1 is enabled (using latin1(Integer)).
    • It encodes using UCS-2 encoding if the message contains special characters that can't be encoded on one octet. Each character is encoded on two octets. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(Boolean)) and UCS-2 is enabled (using ucs2(Integer)).
    Automatic guessing enabled

    Standard encodings are registered with a priority. The priority is used when auto-guessing is enabled. Each registered encoding is tested against the text message starting with the encoding with the highest priority.

    If a priority is set to 0 (or negative number), the encoding is disabled.

    Any registered custom encoder is added into the guessing list according to its priority. Use a the highest value to use custom encoder first. To know default priority values for encodings, see DefaultCloudhopperConfigurer.

    Automatic guessing disabled

    Standard encodings are not registered at all.

    If custom encoders are registered then only those encoders are used.

    If no custom encoders are registered, then default charset encoding is used (see fallback(String)).

    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

      • EncoderBuilder

        public EncoderBuilder(CloudhopperBuilder parent,
                      BuildContext buildContext)
        Initializes the builder with a parent builder. The parent builder is used when calling AbstractParent.and() method. The EnvironmentBuilder is used to evaluate properties when build() method is called.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent builder
        buildContext - for registering instances and property evaluation

    • Method Detail

      • gsm7bitPacked

        public EncoderBuilder gsm7bitPacked(Integer priority)
        Set priority for encoding text messages using GSM 7-bit encoding. GSM 7-bit encoding and GSM 8-bit encoding use the same character tables. Only 7 bits are necessary to represents characters. In GSM 8-bit encoding a leading 0 is added. However, GSM 7-bit encoding is packed. Every character is "merged" with the next one in order to use more characters for the same number of octets.

        If priority value is 0 or negative, it disables GSM 7-bit encoding.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using gsm7bitPacked(). 

         .gsm7bitPacked(10)
 .gsm7bitPacked()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(0)
 
         .gsm7bitPacked(10)
 .gsm7bitPacked()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(0)
        In both cases, gsm7bitPacked(10) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        priority - the priority (highest value means that GSM 7-bit encoding is tried first)
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • gsm7bitPacked

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<EncoderBuilder,Integer> gsm7bitPacked()
        Set priority for encoding text messages using GSM 7-bit encoding. GSM 7-bit encoding and GSM 8-bit encoding use the same character tables. Only 7 bits are necessary to represents characters. In GSM 8-bit encoding a leading 0 is added. However, GSM 7-bit encoding is packed. Every character is "merged" with the next one in order to use more characters for the same number of octets.

        If priority value is 0 or negative, it disables GSM 7-bit encoding.

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .gsm7bitPacked()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(0)

        Non-null value set using gsm7bitPacked(Integer) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .gsm7bitPacked(10)
 .gsm7bitPacked()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(0)
        The value 10 is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value

      • gsm8bit

        public EncoderBuilder gsm8bit(Integer priority)
        Set priority for encoding text messages using GSM 8-bit encoding. GSM 7-bit encoding and GSM 8-bit encoding use the same character tables. Only 7 bits are necessary to represents characters. In GSM 8-bit encoding a leading 0 is added.

        If priority value is 0 or negative, it disables GSM 8-bit encoding.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using gsm8bit(). 

         .gsm8bit(10)
 .gsm8bit()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(5)
 
         .gsm8bit(10)
 .gsm8bit()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(5)
        In both cases, gsm8bit(10) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        priority - the priority (highest value means that GSM 8-bit encoding is tried first)
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • ucs2

        public EncoderBuilder ucs2(Integer priority)
        Set priority for encoding text messages using UCS-2. UCS-2 uses two octets per character.

        If priority value is 0 or negative, it disables UCS-2 encoding.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using ucs2(). 

         .ucs2(10)
 .ucs2()

        this instance for fluent chaining

      • register

        public EncoderBuilder register(Encoder encoder,
                               int priority)
        Register a custom Encoder with associated priority.

        The encoder is registered like standard encoders (see gsm7bitPacked(Integer), gsm8bit(Integer), latin1(Integer), ucs2(Integer)).

        If automatic guessing is enabled (see autoGuess(Boolean)), the registered encoder is also used in automatic guessing (according to priorities).

        If automatic guessing is disabled, only custom Encoder(s) that are registered using this method are used. They are executed according to priority order (highest priority is executed first). If encoder fails to encode (throws EncodingException) then the next one is tried. The registered encoder can also implement SupportingEncoder interface to indicate if the encoder is able to encode or not the text.

        If priority is set to 0 (or negative number), the associated encoder is disabled.

        Parameters:
        encoder - the encoder to register
        priority - the associated priority (the highest priority is executed first)
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • autoGuess

        public EncoderBuilder autoGuess(Boolean enable)
        Enable/disable automatic guessing of message encoding.

        If enables, it automatically guess the best supported encoding in order to use the minimum octets:

        • It encodes using GSM 7-bit default alphabet if the message contains only characters defined in the table. Message is packed so the message can have a maximum length of 160 characters. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(Boolean)) and GSM 7-bit is enabled (using gsm7bitPacked(Integer)).
        • It encodes using GSM 8-bit data encoding if the message contains only characters that can be encoded on one octet. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(Boolean) and GSM 8-bit is enabled (using gsm8bit(Integer)).
        • It encodes using Latin 1 (ISO-8859-1) data encoding if the message contains only characters that can be encoded on one octet. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(Boolean) and GSM 8-bit is enabled (using latin1(Integer)).
        • It encodes using UCS-2 encoding if the message contains special characters that can't be encoded on one octet. Each character is encoded on two octets. This is enable only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(Boolean)) and UCS-2 is enabled (using ucs2(Integer)).

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using autoGuess(). 

         .autoGuess(false)
 .autoGuess()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(true)
 
         .autoGuess(false)
 .autoGuess()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(true)
        In both cases, autoGuess(false) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        enable - enable or disable automatic guessing of encoding
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • autoGuess

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<EncoderBuilder,Boolean> autoGuess()
        Enable/disable automatic guessing of message encoding.

        If enabled, it automatically guess the best supported encoding in order to use the minimum octets:

        • It encodes using GSM 7-bit default alphabet if the message contains only characters defined in the table. Message is packed so the message can have a maximum length of 160 characters. This is enabled only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(Boolean)) and GSM 7-bit is enabled (using gsm7bitPacked(Integer)).
        • It encodes using GSM 8-bit data encoding if the message contains only characters that can be encoded on one octet. This is enabled only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(Boolean) and GSM 8-bit is enabled (using gsm8bit(Integer)).
        • It encodes using Latin 1 (ISO-8859-1) data encoding if the message contains only characters that can be encoded on one octet. This is enabled only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(Boolean) and Latin-1 is enabled (using latin1(Integer)).
        • It encodes using UCS-2 encoding if the message contains special characters that can't be encoded on one octet. Each character is encoded on two octets. This is enabled only if automatic guessing is enabled (using autoGuess(Boolean)) and UCS-2 is enabled (using ucs2(Integer)).

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .autoGuess()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(true)

        Non-null value set using autoGuess(Boolean) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .autoGuess(false)
 .autoGuess()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(true)
        The value false is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value

      • fallback

        public EncoderBuilder fallback(String charsetName)
        Set which Cloudhopper Charset should be used if nothing else is configured.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using fallback(). 

         .fallback(CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM8)
 .fallback()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM)
 
         .fallback(CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM8)
 .fallback()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM)
        In both cases, fallback(CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM8) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        charsetName - the name of the charset to use (see CharsetUtil)
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • fallback

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<EncoderBuilder,String> fallback()
        Set which Cloudhopper Charset should be used if nothing else is configured.

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .fallback()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM)

        Non-null value set using fallback(String) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .fallback(CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM8)
 .fallback()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM)
        The value CharsetUtil.NAME_GSM8 is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value
